sentences: Meie töö on veel täielikumalt lõpetamata.
Täielikus vormis oli tema etteaste imetlusväärne.
context: The word 'täieliku' is the partitive case form of the adjective 'täie', meaning 'complete' or 'full'. It is used to indicate that something is entirely whole, finished, or comprehensive. In Estonian, adjectives change their endings based on case, number, and gender. Here, '-ku' ending indicates the partitive singular masculine/neuter form, commonly used when referring to an entire amount or complete state of something.
